ThingDef.label: ancient educator
ThingDef.description: A very old interactive machine that’s commonly used in the vaults to pass the time. This one is just deactivated.

ThingDef.label: ancient foosball table
ThingDef.description: An old relic of the times, foosball table allows players to engage in the long forgotten game of football without leaving the safety of the vault. Or it would, but its rods are soldered and immobile.

ThingDef.label: large hermetic crate
ThingDef.description: A large crate with some building resources and components. Sealed shut.

ThingDef.label: pipeline junction
ThingDef.description: A large underground chemfuel pipeline. Not connected to anything.

ThingDef.label: ancient bed
ThingDef.description: An old-fashioned metal bed frame with a hard mattress and uncomfortable duvet.

ThingDef.label: rusted hospital bed
ThingDef.description: An old-fashioned metal bed frame with a hard mattress and uncomfortable duvet.

ThingDef.label: wheeled bed
ThingDef.description: An old-fashioned metal bed frame with a hard mattress and uncomfortable duvet.

ThingDef.label: ancient cryptosleep suspender
ThingDef.description: An ancient medical pod that uses partial cryptosleep to slow down the degredation of wounds and help the body heal. Sealed shut.

ThingDef.label: ancient cryptosleep sarcophagus
ThingDef.description: An ancient cryptosleep sarcophagus. Sealed shut.

ThingDef.label: ancient monitor bank
ThingDef.description: A small set of old computer screens.

ThingDef.label: ancient broken defensive turret
ThingDef.description: A destroyed defensive turret top.

ThingDef.label: ancient busted turret platform
ThingDef.description: A destroyed platform for a turret.

ThingDef.label: ancient fuel tank
ThingDef.description: A large fuel tank that could be deconstructed for fuel. If it still had any.

ThingDef.label: ancient input terminal
ThingDef.description: A station with buttons and levers.

ThingDef.label: ancient transmitter
ThingDef.description: A transmitter used to send signals over long range. Non-functional.

ThingDef.label: ancient machinery
ThingDef.description: A set of old machine blocks. Their purpose, if they ever had any, has long been forgotten.

ThingDef.label: ancient water filter
ThingDef.description: A large water filtration system.

ThingDef.label: ancient computer desk
ThingDef.description: An old, no longer operational computer desk.

ThingDef.label: ancient shuttle
ThingDef.description: An ancient, no longer operational shuttle.

ThingDef.label: ancient vitals monitor
ThingDef.description: An old set of monitors to check up on the healing progress of wounded soldiers. Non-functional.

ThingDef.label: ancient chemfuel powered generator
ThingDef.description: Produces a reliable stream of power by consuming chemfuel. Or it would, if it was working.

ThingDef.label: ancient chemfuel powered generator
ThingDef.description: Produces a reliable stream of power by consuming chemfuel. Or it would, if it was working.

ThingDef.label: ancient geothermal plant
ThingDef.description: Produces electricity from geothermal steam geysers. Or it would, if it was working.

ThingDef.label: ancient battery
ThingDef.description: An old, large battery commonly found in vaults, capable of sustaining the entire compound for a nearly infinite amount of time. This one is out-of-service.

ThingDef.label: ancient bio-battery tank
ThingDef.description: Produces a reliable stream of power by consuming biological material such as humans or animals. This one is out-of-service.

ThingDef.label: ancient solar generator
ThingDef.description: The only light this would catch would be if it was set on fire.

ThingDef.label: ancient supply slingshot
ThingDef.description: Often found in ancient vaults, supply slingshot is a complex mechanism that catapults a supply crate across huge distances. This one is non-functional.

ThingDef.label: ancient broadcasting station
ThingDef.description: An ancient broadcasting station. This one is non-functional.

ThingDef.label: ancient broadcasting station
ThingDef.description: An ancient broadcasting station. This one is non-functional.

ThingDef.label: ancient supply crate
ThingDef.description: An ancient crate with some building resources and components. Sealed shut.

ThingDef.label: ancient cooler
ThingDef.description: An ancient cooler. This one is out-of-service.

ThingDef.label: ancient heater
ThingDef.description: An ancient heater. This one is out-of-service.

ThingDef.label: ancient cooking station
ThingDef.description: A large stove and butchering station connected together to streamline the cooking process. Out of order.

ThingDef.label: ancient hydroponic farm
ThingDef.description: An artificial nutrient bath for growing plants. Long inactive.

ThingDef.label: simulation drive
ThingDef.description: A compact supercomputer. Made of cardboard.

ThingDef.label: ancient workshop
ThingDef.description: A large workshop containing machining systems with a simple furnace and smithy station. Out of order.

ThingDef.label: gene-tailoring pod
ThingDef.description: An old and inactive gene-tailoring pod.

ThingDef.label: archogen injector
ThingDef.description: An old and inactive archogen injector.

ThingDef.label: neurostabilizer array
ThingDef.description: An old and inactive neurostabilizer array.

ThingDef.description: An ancient genepack crate. Sealed shut.

ThingDef.label: pneumatic tube launch port
ThingDef.description: A fake pneumatic tube launch port.

ThingDef.label: pneumatic tubes
ThingDef.description: Fake pneumatic tubes.

ThingDef.label: ancient emergency purifier
ThingDef.description: An ancient emergency purifier. It may look on, but it actually isn't.

ThingDef.label: ancient emergency purifier
ThingDef.description: An ancient emergency purifier. Permanently off.

ThingDef.label: locked vault door
ThingDef.description: A sealed vault entrance leading to an underground laboratory. Upon closer inspection, it turns out to be just cardboard.

ThingDef.label: vault ramp
ThingDef.description: A heavily reinforced vehicle ramp with personnel access stairway going down the middle. Upon closer inspection, it turns out to be just cardboard.
